channel.title: How to make your first template driven php site!
channel.description:
[b]PLEASE NOTE:[/b]This is also my first php site. I hope you like it! Here I will teach you how to make your first template driven php site. First you want to create your template of course. This is made by making a simple [i]template.php[/i] file. Ok here is a basic code. [code] <?php echo "$site_title - $page_title"; ?>
[/code] Please Note: This is one table divided into rows and columns. Now we need to make the actual website file. The [i]index.php[/i] file Here is a simple one [code]Money LTD
"; $main .= "Welcome to my first template based website!"; $footer .= "© 2008-2009 My Website"; require('template.php'); ?>[/code] Here is some basic info to help you edit it. [b]$site_title[/b] Is the name of your site. [b]$page_title[/b] Is the name of the page. [b]$main[/b] is the center of the page [b]$main_menu[/b] is the navigation on the left hand side Hope this helps, MrMoney

item.title: How to make your first template driven php site!
item.dc:creator: @MrMoney MrMoney
item.description:
@MrMoney wrote:

Tree:

[quote]Benefit from improperly learning how to handle variables?

Actually, this thread benefits anyone who has read it. By MrMoney making an error, everyone else is able to learn off that. It’s one of the best ways to learn something. Though, a tutorials should generally correct about what it teaches.

I would still consider this a contribution of sorts, even though the tutorial is slightly incorrect. As for the moronic individuals who flamed, i suggest they go learn the definition of maturity.[/quote]
Thanks for standing up for me.
I am working on correcting my errors

Read full topic

item.title: How to make your first template driven php site!
item.dc:creator: @d_sign d_sign
item.description:
@d_sign wrote:

Damn…if you’re going to do it like this, and call it “template-driven”, then you might as well just do this.

[code]<?PHP
$title = “Pg. Title”;
include(“include.php”);
?>
Pg content

<? footer(); ?>

[/code]

Include.php is:

[code]<?PHP
function footer(){
?>

Copyright someone <?PHP } <?PHP echo $title;?> - Sitename.com [/code]

A lot simpler, and i agree with xxlegit
A template-driven website would be something like this:
http://www.codewalkers.com/c/a/Display-Tutorials/Writing-a-Template-System-in-PHP/

Read full topic
item.source: How to make your first template driven php site!

item.title: How to make your first template driven php site!
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

Whats the point of

$main_menu .= “<a href=“http://money.ifixshit.net/forum” title=“Money LTD Website”>Money LTD
”;
$main .= “Welcome to my first template based website!”;
$footer .= “© 2008-2009 My Website”;

? They don’t appear to be previously declared with values…

Afaik, the main use of ‘.=’ is to join two variables together.

For example

$V = ‘owtf’;
echo $V; // prints owtf
$V .= ‘pwnd’;
echo $V; // prints owtfpwnd

Read full topic
item.source: How to make your first template driven php site!

How is this template driven? You’re just echoing variables.
